Client.Name: Department of Energy's Open Energy Data Initiative (OEDI)

Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
Data released under the Department of Energy's (DOE) Open Energy Data Initiative (OEDI). The Open Energy Data Initiative aims to improve and automate access of high-value energy data sets across the U.S. Department of Energy’s programs, offices, and national laboratories. OEDI aims to make data actionable and discoverable by researchers and industry to accelerate analysis and advance innovation.

OEDI's mission is to provide free, universal access to all relevant data generated from projects funded by DOE and supporting partners, to protect DOE's investment in research and development through proper data management and the open transfer of knowledge, to fuel innovation, reduce duplication of effort, and promote scientific discovery in the energy sector.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
OEDI contains data from all aspects of energy research, development, and operations, including data on:

energy from waves, currents and tides
geothermal energy
solar energy
wind energy
device engineering
performance and testing
economic analysis
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
Website has recommended data processing methods, but we have developed a system specifically for processing AWS datasets.
After downloading, we cut the data into smaller than 32GB sectors and then send the order.
